intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited elaeodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and produces tiny, clustered fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
